newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Reed-Elsevier sees MDL EPS input from 1998.
newsitem.headline: Reed-Elsevier sees MDL EPS input from 1998.

text.p: Anglo-Dutch publishing group Reed-Elsevier said MDL Information Systems Inc of the United States would make a positive contribution to earnings from 1998.
"Starting from 1998 earnings will be enhanced by the acquisition," Elsevier NV executive committee member Paul Vlek said in a telephone interview.

Reed Elsevier said earlier it would make a public bid of around $32 per share for the outstanding shares of MDL, putting a price tag of around $320 million on the information systems, databases and supporting services firm.
Vlek added that while MDL would not be earnings-enhancing before 1998, neither would it dilute earnings. "From the start it will be neither accretive or dilutive," he said.
Vlek said Reed-Elsevier held no shares in MDL prior to the bid and said he expected the deal, which requires U.S. regulatory approval, to be completed towards the end of the second quarter.
"As far as I know there are no major shareholders holding more than 10 percent," he added.
